title: New: Egyptian Hip Hop – Yoro Diallo
body:
Pitchfork’s intelligent and considered insight is one of the reasons many view it as the essential music website, at least for wannabe hipsters and try-hard scene kids.

Take [this stunning review](http://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/14258-yoro-diallo/) of the new **Egyptian Hip Hop** track – _“Here’s the record’s second single, “Yoro Diallo”; you’ll remember we shared the first single, [“SYH”](http://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/14035-syh/), last month.”._ Wow, game changing stuff.

Anyway, here is the new single from Manchester odd-pop group Egyptian Hip Hop, and you know what? It’s the best thing they’ve done so far. Jerky Gang of Four guitar lines and Talking Heads’ inspired melodies, their debut LP entitled Good Don’t Sleep is shaping up rather nicely.

Take this stunning review of the new Egyptian Hip Hop track – “Here’s the record’s second single, “Yoro Diallo”; you’ll remember we shared the first single, “SYH”, last month.”. \[…\]
